Race.SpecificTitle: Constable -- Justice of the Peace Ward  8
Gravity Drainage District No. 1 -- 5 Mills Renewal - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Gravity Drainage District No. 1 Proposition
(Tax Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall Gravity Drainage District No. 1 of the Parish of Livingston, State of Louisiana (the "District"), renew the levy of a five (5) mill tax on all the property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $839,750.00 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2021 and ending with the year 2030, for the purpose of paying the expense of maintaining and operating drainage works in the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Protection District No. 7 Prop. No. 1 of 2 -- 10 Mills Renewal - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 7 Proposition No. 1 of 2
(Tax Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall Fire Protection District No. 7 of Livingston Parish, Louisiana (the "District"), under the provisions of Article VI, Sections 30 and 32 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, as amended, La. R.S. 40:1501 and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be authorized to renew the levy and collection of a tax of ten (10) mills on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation within the District (an estimated $86,000.00 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2023 and ending with the year 2032, for the purpose of maintaining and operating the District's fire protection facilities and for purchasing fire trucks and other firefighting equipment?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Protection District No. 7 Prop. No. 2 of 2 -- $32.00 Service Charge Renewal - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 7 Proposition No. 2 of 2
(Service Charge Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall Fire Protection District No. 7 of Livingston Parish, Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to renew a service charge in an amount not to exceed $32.00 per annum for each residential or commercial structure for a term not to exceed ten (10) years for the purpose of fire protection services, commencing January 1, 2020, to be assessed on persons owning each such structure, whether occupied or unoccupied, located wholly or partly within the boundaries of the District (an estimated $36,500.00 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the service charge for an entire year)?
